intro: Astrococcus coriaceus, commonly known as the rough astrococcus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Astrococcus coriaceus is often used in ornamental gardening for its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
